text:
''Psychology researchers David Dunning and Justin Kruger at Cornell University published a seminal paper entitled ‚ÄúUnskilled and Unaware of It: How Difficulties in Recognizing One‚Äôs Own Incompetence Lead to Inflated Self-Assessments.‚Äù They demonstrated a horrific truth of the human condition: people who are very bad at a thing can nevertheless form the delusion that they are really good at it. To put it another way, stupid people have no difficulty in imagining they are smart.‚Äù 

''The world of conspiracy theories is one where stupid people dismiss the expertise of highly qualified people, and attribute to these experts a wicked desire to lie to and gull the masses. 
In other words, they portray experts as sinister enemies of the people. Conspiracy theories reflect the increasingly prevalent notion that the average, uneducated person is always right ‚Äì can always see the real truth of a situation ‚Äì while the educated experts are always wrong because they are deliberately lying to the people to further a conspiracy by the elite against the people. It is increasingly being perceived as a ‚Äúsin‚Äù, a crime, to be smart, to be an expert.‚Äù 

From the book: Dumbocalypse Now: The First Dunning-Kruger President by Joe Dixon

text:
¬†@Misha Amashukeli¬† Glad you brought it up because I am a software engineer and have many direct observations in my 15+ years of experience. Let me start with my finish: "Trump was a successful business man. Did he get the U.S. into any good business deals? Nope. So why are you repeating the same kind of foolish thinking for Bill Gates?" you are proving my point!

 There's a huge distinction between notoriety and success in an industry, and actual knowledge and expertise in a field. Everyone, including smart liberals confuse the two and act like the two are the same. Bill Gates is NOT an expert in computer science! He was a competent programmer in his day, at best. I say that as a software engineer who completed a CS degree around the time Bill Gates was more relevant and revered in the space (mid 2000s). It was well known that Bill Gates was nothing beyond a "good" programmer -- considered bad by some standards too. And the even greater distinction for computer science problem solving (I won't get into this) is an even further stretch label to apply to Bill Gates. Bill Gates was certainly competent enough to understand what he was doing on a computer, but so are so many. We have to recognize that him getting to be what he is (or became) was NOT because of his prowess as an engineer or nerdy problem solver but a function of corporate power structures and privilege. Does a black man who's twice as smart as Bill Gates in the same company at the same time make it to his position or even close to a VP position? If you say "yes" you're a damn liar and racism isn't the only problem because a white woman wouldn't have made it that high up either. FYI, Mark Zuckerberg is in the same boat. Zuckerberg is NOT a rare talent in CS. He just took a particular idea, with capital (ability to not make money for a while due to privilege), and it worked out. Bill Gates and Mark Zuckerberg would have to study to qualify for an entry-level software engineering interview today or they wouldn't get the job -- and that's not bad mouthing them. As a software engineer, tech CEOs, even those who were formerly engineers themselves I know for a fact (based on my own experience in the field) are never top tier engineers. They are usually only "good enough" and are doing something entirely different to rise through the ranks, or have something entirely different (white, male, looks like an engineering-type to gain confidence, speaks a certain way).

And "high level infrastructure stuff" is not Bill Gates' expert domain either!  He founded/ran a tech company a the U.S. - a market that happens also have high military/diplomatic power for capitalistic global expansion! I grant that Bill Gates, and others, was at least smart enough survive and grow then; and he especially has time to read and think about other issues today. Cool, but you're still just idolizing a rich guy for qualities that they haven't demonstrated. However Bill Gates built Microsoft then, would fail today. Is Bill Gates smart enough to do it again? Did he solve a problem of societal need or did he exploit a market/business void and get rich? Hint: Bill Gates didn't solve a fundamental computer science problem - in fact, he was worse than competitors (which were entirely free) in his day at solving the computing problems. He created a product that consumers who had disposable income wanted and got rich quicker. He  then used that dominance and capital to impose on, and defeat clearly better solutions for at least a decade or two. Anyone worth their salt in knowledge about big tech companies in the late 70s-early 2000s knows this. He had a tactic for getting rich, but it was not technical merit in the slightest. Trump was a successful business man too. His methods sound similar to Bill Gates don't they. Did Trump get the U.S. into any good deals? Nope. So why are you repeating the same kind of thinking for Bill Gates?

text:
¬†@jrojala¬† Not necessarily. What Gates is using is a high focus lens with maybe 1.8 ratio of the aperture. My guess is a 100mm lens standing several meters in front of him, and he is sitting in the middle of the room with a wall far behind him. He then just adjusts the lens to focus on him. But if you set the camera right in front of you with let's say a 35mm lens, and the background is right behind your head, like in Trevor's case, you can't achieve this effect that easily, you can using macro rings and such, but it will not work well.

And the camera doesn't need to be anything super fancy at all. Any Canon Camera from about 450$ and up will do. And Bill gates has like 100.000.000.000 dollars. He can afford it. Anyone can to be honest.

text:
@Laura Lea Lovekey¬† It looks like the Virgin? Mary and I have GENUINE concerns that should be evaluated separately from your nut friends. I am a degreed Electronic Engineer.  I wrote software for 2 decades,  have been a Program Manager and have traveled. 

The Unix Operating system and computers they run on have lasted for decades.  Unix is far more reliable than anything Microsoft has ever attempted. Unix is the backbone of the Internet of commerce, banking, etc. Microsoft laughably attempted to enter that (Enterprise) server market and failed miserably. 

Those of us who know, know that Microsoft Operating Systems were all the same, regardless of their name yet every year, Wall Street and Madison Avenue helped that clown tell the world to purchase his new software which was not backward compatible meaning if one person "upgraded" to the new software,  so must everyone else.  The Microsoft Operating system also had to run in newer, faster computers. Guess what, they got rich too. That ALSO was a Lie because the software now runs in smartphones that initially were not nearly as fast as the best Personal Computers.

The depletion of resources  https://www.engineering.com/Hardware/ArticleID/17668/What-Raw-Materials-Are-Used-to-Make-Hardware-in-Computing-Devices.aspx#:~:text=Though%20there%20is%20a%20wide,%2C%20zinc%2C%20iron%20and%20nickel. and the environmental destruction in countries like Pakistan https://youtu.be/axYKPbr9_MA China, Ghana, India and others do not a hero make.

I do not think that Bill Gates was a hero then, and I do not think he is a hero now. He was greedy and fans fawning over his picture quality should look at the bigger picture because all evidence I can find is that Bill Gates has not reformed. Ivy Lee didn't change the person that J.D. Rockefeller was, they just flooded the media with stories that he was a "swell guy". To this day, it is difficult to find criticism of J.D. Rockefeller or Bill Gates but both are/were sociopathic people interested in accumulating wealth and influence.

text:
Bill has been hinting or warning several times in recent years about a worldwide pandemic which will kill a large percentage of the population (he has estimated about 30 million people will die in a pandemic). He said ‚Äúbecause history has taught us there will be another deadly global pandemic". No, history only tells us what happened in the past! It was like he knew a pandemic was about to happen! He also said "And, as biological weapons of mass destruction become easier to create in the lab, there is an increasing risk of a bioterror attack".
Again in 2019, Bill Gates featured in and produced a Netflix documentary series called "Explained", and in an episode called "The Next Pandemic", he said in an interview that he predicted a coronavirus-style pandemic which would kill millions of people. He even warned of such a virus coming from a "wet market" (a market selling fresh meat, fish or produce, often associated with live animals) in China! He said it would take years to find a cure for a new virus outbreak. Just months later, it happened - is Bill psychic too?!
Bill has said publicly several times in interviews or presentations that the world population is too high, and needs to be reduced. In a 2010 TED talk he said, ¬´The world today has 6.8 billion people. That's heading up to about nine billion. Now if we do a really great job on new vaccines, health care, reproductive health services, we could lower that by perhaps 10 or 15 percent‚Äù. It is interesting that Bill Gates and his Foundation are huge promoters of vaccines to developing countries. I personally think people in these countries preferentially need 1) improved nutrition, 2) clean water, and 3) better sanitation and modern utilities such as electricity and waste processing (i.e. sewerage systems) to reduce infections, illnesses and deaths. But not the Gates Foundation, as their priority is just vaccines for population control. It was these 3 improvements to our lives that massively slowed the incidences and deaths from infections, decades before vaccines were made available.
On 29th February 2020, Bill Gates announced to the world that the coronavirus IS a pandemic and should be announced as such, over a week before the WHO officially did announce the pandemic. In his announcement, he claims that the coronavirus is a "once-in-a-century pathogen" which may kill up to 50 million people. Bill was generously offering solutions to the pandemic through his Foundation ‚Äì obviously, as he appears to have planned well for such a situation! Of course one of his solutions is a fast-tracked vaccine, using techniques from one of the companies his Foundation has funded, that apparently make it possible to produce vaccines within weeks. Never mind the testing process which is supposed to take years before they can be made available to the public.
In a recent interview (24th March 2020) with Chris Anderson (the Curator of TED Talks), Bill suggested that there should be a system of "certificates" that people will need to carry around to show who has recovered from the COVID-19 infection, and who is vaccinated (when the COVID-19 vaccine is made available), as he doesn't want people moving around the world who haven't been vaccinated for this infection. This is sounding like restrictions of movement or travel, unless you have been vaccinated and have identification papers to prove it - much like everyone having to carry ID papers with them at all times in Nazi Germany. France is using such movement certificates now for people to be able to leave their houses. However the "certificates" being considered by Bill are in a digital form, of either a microchip being inserted under the skin, or a "quantum-dot tattoo".
The Gates Foundation have also funded a project with MIT in December 2019, to develop a digital form of vaccination certificate, by storing data in encapsulated micro particles stored under the skin. These particles are injected at the same time as the vaccine using a microneedle patch, rather than a typical needle and syringe.
In an interview with CBS on 2nd April 2020, Bill was giving advice on health policy and strategies on the current pandemic. He was also giving estimates of how long this issue will last. Again he was promoting his vaccine companies and vaccines being the key to stopping this pandemic, before we can go back to our normal lives. Note the hint that you may not be able to go back to your normal life without a vaccine (and a fast-tracked vaccine which won't go through all the usual tests for safety). As he is not a doctor or health expert, he should not be interviewed or having a say on this topic, because of all of his conflicts of interest here. He did also suggest that there could be more pandemics in the future.
In a recent online Q&A session on Reddit (March 2020), Bill called for a "national tracking system similar to South Korea" to monitor people with an infection to "understand where the disease is". Again, more monitoring, tracking and control of the population.
On 28th March 2020, The Gates Foundation announced an alliance with the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative (run by Facebook Founder, Mark Zuckerberg and his wife) and MasterCard and the Wellcome charity for finding affordable treatments for COVID-19. They announced they were working together with the WHO on a "COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator" to evaluate and repurpose existing drugs for treating this infection. They claim that since these existing medications have completed clinical trials, it would make them quicker to make them more available in this pandemic. I don't think so, as these medications won't have ANY clinical trials for safety or efficacy against this specific virus, and clinical trials will still need to be done. If they are looking for affordable and effective solutions, then why not look at natural substances like vitamin and mineral supplements, which have been proven to be safe and effective against all other viruses including other coronavirus types? But that won't make them any profits though.
Moreover, Bill Gates said during a discussion held in Switzerland 3 years ago these very words:  ‚Äúan epidemic either naturally caused or intentionally caused‚Äù which means he believes that an epidemic can be caused by humans. He also said in an interview that ‚Äúwe see a lot of things that are going very well, things like producing childhood death¬ª. Slip of the tongue? Well he didn‚Äôt correct himself...wow...This is a further proof of him being evil...and it makes sense since he wants depopulation.
Gates‚Äô obsession with vaccines seems to be fueled by a conviction to save the world with technology.
Promising his share of $450 million of $1.2 billion to eradicate Polio, Gates took control of India‚Äôs National Technical Advisory Group on Immunization (NTAGI) which mandated up to 50 doses (Table 1) of polio vaccines through overlapping immunization programs to children before the age of five. Indian doctors blame the Gates campaign for a devastating non-polio acute flaccid paralysis (NPAFP) epidemic that paralyzed 490,000 children beyond expected rates between 2000 and 2017. In 2017, the Indian government dialed back Gates‚Äô vaccine regimen and asked Gates and his vaccine policies to leave India. NPAFP rates dropped precipitously.
In 2017, the World Health Organization (WHO) reluctantly admitted that the global explosion in polio is predominantly vaccine strain. The most frightening epidemics in Congo, Afghanistan, and the Philippines, are all linked to vaccines. In fact, by 2018, 70% of global polio cases were vaccine strain.
During Gates‚Äô 2002 MenAfriVac campaign in Sub-Saharan Africa, Gates‚Äô operatives forcibly vaccinated thousands of African children against meningitis. Approximately 50 of the 500 children vaccinated developed paralysis.
South African newspapers complained, ‚ÄúWe are guinea pigs for the drug makers.‚Äù Nelson Mandela‚Äôs former Senior Economist, Professor Patrick Bond, describes Gates‚Äô philanthropic practices as ‚Äúruthless and immoral.‚Äù
In 2010, the Gates Foundation funded a phase 3 trial of GSK‚Äôs experimental malaria vaccine, killing 151 African infants and causing serious adverse effects including paralysis, seizure, and febrile convulsions to 1,048 of the 5,949 children.
In 2010, Gates committed $10 billion to the WHO saying, ‚ÄúWe must make this the decade of vaccines.‚Äù A month later, Gates said in a Ted Talk that new vaccines ‚Äúcould reduce population‚Äù.
In 2014, Kenya‚Äôs Catholic Doctors Association accused the WHO of chemically sterilizing millions of unwilling Kenyan women with a ‚Äútetanus‚Äù vaccine campaign. Independent labs found a sterility formula in every vaccine tested. After denying the charges, WHO finally admitted it had been developing the sterility vaccines for over a decade.  Similar accusations came from Tanzania, Nicaragua, Mexico, and the Philippines.
In 2014, the Gates Foundation funded tests of experimental HPV vaccines, developed by Glaxo Smith Kline (GSK) and Merck, on 23,000 young girls in remote Indian provinces. Approximately 1,200 suffered severe side effects, including autoimmune and fertility disorders. Seven died. Indian government investigations charged that Gates-funded researchers committed pervasive ethical violations: pressuring vulnerable village girls into the trial, bullying parents, forging consent forms, and refusing medical care to the injured girls. The case is now in the country‚Äôs Supreme Court.
A 2017 study (Morgenson et. al. 2017) showed that WHO‚Äôs popular DTP vaccine is killing more African children than the diseases it prevents. DTP-vaccinated girls suffered 10x the death rate of children who had not yet received the vaccine. WHO has refused to recall the lethal vaccine which it forces upon tens of millions of African children annually.

¬†@Overseers Guardian¬† LMAO. While that's certainly possible, more often than not, it's because the rest of the herd walled the bad stuff away from you, like the flu. 

The problem with COVID-19 is that the herd doesn't have immunity-boosting aids against it yet and you're just a series of jumps away from getting infected.

People died from the flu in the millions before the vaccines and millions more will potentially die should an avian or swine-based flu virus jumps over to human hosts and becomes human-to-human. 

So no, anti-vaxxers and people who just believe they can dodge microbes like the Flash dodges bullets will never beat the truth of science. People should realize that there are worse pathogens out there and we are "lucky" that COVID isn't more lethal. We should learn from it to be better prepared for the future when a civilization-ending microorganism challenges our very existence as a species.

text:
¬†@Sherief Woodard¬† Good God, please round out your education on the subject. Yes, the virus isn't going anywhere but it is not because there is a conspiracy to keep it around for profit. Like the flu, it's a virus that has multi-specie hosts. 

To eliminate it, the whole world will have to isolate, quarantine, and treat, not only humans but every animal susceptible to getting the disease. Good luck with that. You make it seem humanity has already mastered disease to a fine-tuned art that the "masters" can play the whole world like a fiddle. Please.

And you're completely wrong about the scenario you're painting. This situation we're in is not good for any business. Where do you think these emergency funds and reimbursements come from? If no one works and/or the economy grinds to a halt, who's left to tax? No taxes; empty coffers. The well will eventually run dry and even big pharma will close shop too. 

The only reason they're handing out money is for people to spend it to keep businesses alive, but that's not a perpetual machine. It follows the laws of diminishing return just like everything else and we don't live in a closed economic system. Goods and services rely on external sources that will funnel away some of that money out of the system. 


There is plenty in the world that is out to get you, but not everything is.
